talk.author: did:plc:qtg5imfwej5xhwlvl745wkxf
talk.utter:
I hate that word so much. 
A bunch of idiots misunderstood cultivation theory and ran with it.

We're not gonna emulate everything we see in fiction like dumb little children. Things being "normalized" in media doesn't mean we'll actually do it.

talk.author: did:plc:735avqzlr2zlqcbo6gdjnyes
talk.utter:
It has to be like .. a pervasive culture force, and even then it depends on what it is 

Actual normalization is more about unconscious attitudes, it isn't going to make people do crimes ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

talk.author: did:plc:qtg5imfwej5xhwlvl745wkxf
talk.utter: Even the original cultivation theory study about violence on TV found that it just made people more subconsciously paranoid about violence happening TO them, not make them wanna go out and do it themselves.

can't even be lesbian anymore without people assuming you're a horny guy and resorting to unintentional (?) transphobia.

talk.author: did:plc:dbi5iz3thdmdb2tm5h5lace3
talk.utter: Now if we're talking social norms and normalisation (perhaps that doesn't actually apply to social norms? idk) that bastardisation actually is reflecting repressive social norms since the whole way people treat women's sexuality, sexualisation of women actually is modulated by a framework

talk.author: did:plc:dbi5iz3thdmdb2tm5h5lace3
talk.utter:
which calls itself feminist but only advocates for a very set group (and is hardly even effective in doing that).

Like when people will call mahoako male gaze, a work with only women, or when they do have their assumptions challenged and the author is a woman and their recourse is

talk.author: did:plc:dbi5iz3thdmdb2tm5h5lace3
talk.utter: "well that's still gross and bad since she's clearly just catering to the men!" which is just again, even when it's right in front of them denying lesbian desire.

talk.author: did:plc:qtg5imfwej5xhwlvl745wkxf
talk.utter:
Yep. The whole idea of female sexuality being "for men" unless it's done in a specific or subtle  way is so misogynistic.

Girls love seeing girls. The "men are visual creatures and women aren't" is a sexist stereotype that hurts both cis and trans lesbians.
